column3: It shall be seen to.

column2: If Betty Higden can be turned for all the same, you shall come here and be taken care of for life, and be made able to keep her in other ways than the turning.'
column3: If Betty Higden can be turned for all the same, you shall come here and be taken care of for life, and be made able to keep her in other ways than the turning.'

column2: 'Even as to that, mum,' answered the ecstatic Sloppy, 'the turning might be done in the night, don't you see?
column3: 'Even as to that, mum,' answered the ecstatic Sloppy, 'the turning might be done in the night, don't you see?

column2: I could be here in the day, and turn in the night.
column3: I could be here in the day, and turn in the night.

column2: I don't want no sleep, I don't.
column3: I don't want no sleep, I don't.

column2: Or even if I any ways should want a wink or two,' added Sloppy, after a moment's apologetic reflection, 'I could take 'em turning.
column3: Or even if I any ways should want a wink or two,' added Sloppy, after a moment's apologetic reflection, 'I could take 'em turning.

column2: I've took 'em turning many a time, and enjoyed 'em wonderful!'
column3: I've took 'em turning many a time, and enjoyed 'em wonderful!'

column2: On the grateful impulse of the moment, Mr Sloppy kissed Mrs Boffin's hand, and then detaching himself from that good creature that he might have room enough for his feelings, threw back his head, opened his mouth wide, and uttered a dismal howl.
column3: On the grateful impulse of the moment, Mr Sloppy kissed Mrs Boffin's hand, and then detaching himself from that good creature that he might have room enough for his feelings, threw back his head, opened his mouth wide, and uttered a dismal howl.

column2: It was creditable to his tenderness of heart, but suggested that he might on occasion give some offence to the neighbours: the rather, as the footman looked in, and begged pardon, finding he was not wanted, but excused himself; on the ground 'that he thought it was Cats.'
column3: It was creditable to his tenderness of heart, but suggested that he might on occasion give some offence to the neighbours: the rather, as the footman looked in, and begged pardon, finding he was not wanted, but excused himself; on the ground 'that he thought it was Cats.'
